summary: This bill, the Crow Tribe Water Rights Settlement Amendments Act of 2025, amends the original 2010 act to improve water rights settlements for the Crow Tribe. Key changes include redefining terms related to the MR&I Project, repealing the MR&I System, and modifying the Crow Settlement Fund and Crow CIP Implementation Account. The bill also specifies the use of funds for infrastructure, land purchase, and includes technical and conforming amendments to the original act's sections. Title to infrastructure remains with the Tribe, and the Federal Government has no obligation for ongoing maintenance.
